required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modifiers of Tenofovir in the Female Genital Tract
clinical_study.official_title: Modifiers of Tenofovir Exposure in the Female Genital Tract of African Women on Depo-provera

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Two-armed, single visit, pharmacokinetic study to compare tenofovir diphosphate concentrations in cervical tissues of women on Depo-Provera contraception vs non-hormonal contraception.

primary_outcome.description: Assess the influence of hormonal contraception on tenofovir concentrations in cervical tissues

secondary_outcome.description: To determine relationship between local inflammation and drug disposition in the female genital tract

secondary_outcome.measure: Gene expression of drug metabolizing enzymes and transporters
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the influence of hormonal contraception on the expression of drug metabolizing enzymes and transporters in cervical tissue
To identify potential role of the vaginal microbiome in local drug disposition

intervention.description: Two cervical biopsies, blood plasma, PBMC, urine, and two cervicovaginal swabs will be collected at a single study visit
Two cervical biopsies, blood plasma, PBMC, urine, and two cervicovaginal swabs will be collected at a single study visit

study_pop.textblock: Women will be recruited from an existing cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female, or transgender female with a cervix, aged 18-35 years old
- HIV-positive
- Stable on antiretroviral regimen containing TDF for at least 2 weeks at time of enrollment.
- Virally suppressed (HIV-RNA copies <50 copies/mL) for at least 6 months at time of enrollment.
- Willing to refrain from vaginal intercourse and use of vaginal devices such as douches and sex toys within 72 hours of the biopsy visit.
- Willing and able to give signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently pregnant or previous pregnancy within 3 months of enrollment
- Currently breast feeding
- Symptomatic vaginal infection within 2 weeks prior to enrollment
- Unexplained, undiagnosed abnormal bleeding per vagina, bleeding per vagina during or following vaginal intercourse, or gynecologic surgery within 90 days prior to enrollment
- History of vulvar/vaginal/ cervical dysplasia, neoplasia or cancer, atypical squamous cells of undetermined significance, condyloma, or human papilloma virus (HPV) in the past year
- Use of oral and/or vaginal preparations of antibiotic or antifungal medications within 30 days prior to the enrollment visit
